column9: I have several serious medical conditions that each cause VERY sever pain. I also have Gastroparesis, which makes taking pain pills worthless. column2: hatedit, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After surgery I woke up with terrible pain and a headache.  When I was alert enough to ask the nurse what she was inserting in my IV she told me Diluid and that it would relax me and put me to sleep.  Joke on that one!  I felt like I had a brain tumor and was litterly climbing the walls for hours.  Later after calling the nurse again and again for help she came in with the same medication.  I refused it and she gave me regular Tylenol (which usually does not work) but I took it anyway and the next morning the headache was so bad and they would do nothing else for it so I left the hospital against medical advice.

column9: After an ovarian cyst had burst, I had SEVERE pain, at first they gave me Morphine and it didnt even cut my pain. Then, they started me with doses of dilaudid. I told them I would rather deal with more pain than more puking...
